# Draft:Tucker Award

Richard L. Tucker Leadership & Service Award
The Richard L. Tucker Leadership & Service Award is an annual recognition presented by the Construction Industry Institute (CII) to individuals who have made significant contributions to the advancement of CII's mission and the success of the organization.
History
The award is named in honor of Dr. Richard L. Tucker, who led the effort to establish CII in 1983 and served as its first director until his retirement in 1998. Dr. Tucker played a key role in shaping CII as a collaborative research and development organization focused on improving the construction industry.
Criteria and Selection
Recipients are selected by the CII Executive Committee. The award may be given to:
* Active participants in CII programs.
* Individuals not affiliated with member organizations who meet the award criteria.
The award is presented no more than once per year and only when a deserving candidate is identified.
Key criteria include:
* Significant contributions to CII’s mission.
* Serving as an ambassador or promoter of CII.
* Mentoring or supporting other CII participants.
* Long-term involvement with CII.
* Not being a current or former CII staff member.
Recipients
Recent recipients of the award include:
* 2025 – Tricia Thibodeaux
* 2024 – Doug Omichinski
* 2023 – Aivars Krumins
* 2022 – G. Edward Gibson, Jr.
* 2021 – Wayne Crew
* 2020 – William R. Badger
